articles.description: You won't get the latest SoC, camera tech, and a few other bells and whistles with our great value choices, however, these phones are capable of handling almost everything you can throw at them.
articles.content: Google's phone ambitions took a big, bold leap with the Pixel 6 and 6 Pro, leaving the Pixel 5a as the company's last Pixel to sport that Nexus-like understated, classy look. Although the aesthetics … [+1509 chars]

articles.title: The $109K Ford F-150 Raptor R is the brand's most powerful pickup - Fox News
articles.description: The 2023 Ford F-150 Raptor R is the brand's most powerful and expensive pickup ever. The high performance off-roader features a 700 hp supercharged V8.
articles.content:
Ford has revved up the F-150 Raptor.
The 2023 F-150 Raptor R is a higher performance version of the desert racing-inspired pickup that has been a hit for the brand for over a decade.
The top of the… [+3037 chars]

articles.title: Apple's iPhone 14 Max could be in short supply at launch; here's why - The Indian Express
articles.description: Apple plans to launch four different iPhone 14 models this year, but the 5.4-inch device would be discontinued in favour of a new 6.7-inch iPhone.
articles.content: Apple’s iPhone 14 Max could be in short supply when it launches in the fall, Display analyst Ross Young said in a tweet. For Apple fans, this means that it’s going to be especially difficult to get o… [+2840 chars]

articles.title: Chris Evans calls his iPhone 12 Pro too heavy, asks Apple for a home button - The Verge
articles.description: Chris Evans, who has played Captain America and is now starring in a new Netflix flick, The Gray Man, is complaining about his new iPhone 12 Pro. It’s too heavy, and Apple ditched the home button that was on his old iPhone 6S.
articles.content:
